reviewText: An honest portrayal of one of the greatest First Ladies (next to Eleanor Roosevelt of course).  Betty was a truly beautiful woman and what happened to her only makes one want to love her all the more.  A truly honest straightforward American lady.
It was delivered fast and was as described.

VERY PLEASED WITH THIS DVD. LEARNED MANY THINGS I DID NOT KNOW ABOUT BETTY FORD I HIGHLY RECOMMED IT
I REALLY ENJOYED IT

Betty Ford helped remove some of the stigma of being an alcoholic who seeks treatment. Gena Rowlands did a good job - so did Josef Sommer as Gerald Ford. This movie is a permanent part of my collection (so is My Name Is Bill W).

After watching a few movies staring Gena Rowlands, I'm sorry to say that for the talent she possesses, and the versatility with which she executes her roles, she is very underrated. Her portrayal of Betty Ford, presenting difficult periods in the life of a loving wife and mother, was moving, thought-provoking and informative. There is a thread of being direct and unswerving in her style of acting that often requires her to be physical in many scenes, in which you think she is going to hurt herself. No matter what the character, how low or embarrassing the circumstance, she is still a lady with a sense of self respect that lifts her humanity above the trials at that moment.

GENA ROWLANDS GIVES ANOTHER WONDERFUL PERFORMANCE AS BETTY FORD. NOTE: ALL THESE WARNER ARCHIVES DVDS WILL NOT WORK ON SYSTEMS THAT HAVE A RECORDER OF ANY KIND. YOU WILL ONLY BE ABLE TO WATCH THESE GREAT TITLES ON "PLAY ONLY" DEVICES. THEY PLAY GREAT ON MY CHEAP DVD PLAYER AND WON'T READ ON MY EXPENSIVE DVD/VHS COMBO.
